While lawyers say more celebrities are about to accuse journalists of hacking their phones, Deputy Tony Blair Nick Clegg sought to draw a line under the controversy. I don't think this government will miss a beat in terms of just pressing ahead with the plan that we have set out for the next four and a half years, he told the BBC.`` Andy Coulson has been very clear that he was not in any way responsible for phone hacking or had any knowledge of it. Mr. Watson said word of Mr. Andy Coulson 's resignation had been`` sneaked out'' on a busy news day when former Tony Blair was testifying before an inquiry into the Iraq war. Spin and obfuscation is all we get from Downing Street- we need to get to the truth, Mr. Watson said. For the Labour Party, Mr. Andy Coulson 's departure partly overshadowed its own woes over the departure of Mr. Johnson, a veteran Labour official and former government minister. him dog-gone angry. Mark Buehrle admitted to MLB.com recently that there were times while watching the NFL, that he wished Michael Vick would get hurt. Instead he won NFL comeback player of the year.
